item.description:
Forest Gardening: Perennial Food Production with Jonathan Bates. Saturday, May 21, 11am - 12:30

We have been invited to join with the Greater Seacoast Permaculture Group in New Hampshire for a presentation on Forest Gardening for Perennial Food Production. This promises to be an amazing introduction to perennial food gardening by Jonathan Bates, one of our regions noted experts. We will learn about the variety of plants and methods of growing through a slide show and lively discussion.

The group will also be able to take advantage of a discounted group order of plants for edible landscapes. Go to PermacultureNursery.com to see what's available.

This will also be a wonderful opportunity to meet others in our bio-region who are implementing permaculture on a home scale.

Cost is sliding scale of $5-15 per person.

Jonathan Bates runs Food Forest Farm Permaculture Nursery, a source for useful,edible, hard to find plants and seeds. He’s been studying, creating and working with rural and urban gardens in the Connecticut River Valley for the past ten years, and is a co-designer and inhabitant of an edible forest garden in Holyoke, MA.

More info on NH Seacoast here: http://www.meetup.com/GreaterSeacoastPermaculture/events/16534676/
item.name: Edible Forest Gardening: Perennial Food Production
